pr_title: Hive 22255 : Hive don't trigger Major Compaction automatically if table contains only base files

timeline.message:
Merge pull request #1 from apache/master

syncing forked repo using upstream - 05-29-2018
HIVE-22255: Hive don't trigger Major Compaction automatically if table contains only base files
Hive 22255 : Hive don't trigger Major Compaction automatically if table contains only base files

timeline.author: pvary

replies.bodyText: without setting explicitly here, insert query find it null and skip the here
replies.author: rajkrrsingh

timeline.bodyText: Maybe use findAny() instead of count()?
timeline.author: pvary

timeline.bodyText: Unnecessary parenthesis and also I think dir.getObsolete().size() check is not needed, since multiBase is true
timeline.author: pvary

timeline.bodyText:
Meybe we should move this select out to a different method, since this is the copy of the one used in compact().
Also I would add state cleaning as well. We do not want 2 cleaners running parallel
timeline.author: pvary

replies.bodyText: Can we use preparedstatement here as well?
replies.author: pvary

replies.bodyText:
Further clarified thoughts:

It would be good to have a single method inserting to the COMPACTION_QUEUE table
We should use a preparedstatement for this so JDBC execution could be faster
TxnHandler.compact() should check for only INITIATED/WORKING status - it might still worth tho start a new compaction, even if the cleanup not finished yet
TxnHandler.requestCleanup() should check for INITIATED/WORKING/READY_TO_CLEAN status (the first 2 should not be there anyway), so we do not queue multiple compactions for the same table/partition

Thanks,
Peter
replies.author: pvary

timeline.bodyText: I think, we really want to ignore this, so we would like to return here.
timeline.author: pvary

replies.bodyText: moved this logline to debug and return from here.
replies.author: rajkrrsingh

timeline.bodyText: Could we do this in a try with resource construct?
timeline.author: pvary

timeline.bodyText: Again this is very similar that we have in compact(), we might to create a new method for it and reuse.
timeline.author: pvary

replies.bodyText: Also using a prepared statement would be nice, I think
replies.author: pvary

timeline.bodyText: try with resource would be nice here too
timeline.author: pvary

replies.bodyText: incorporated the suggested change for stmt and pst. try-resource with dbConn make code clumsy with so many nested try-catch so I skipped it.
replies.author: rajkrrsingh

timeline.bodyText: If there is some exception before in the finally, this unlockInternal will not be called. Isn't this a problem?
timeline.author: pvary

replies.bodyText: unlockInternal is mostly applicable for derby so I think it should not create the problem.
replies.author: rajkrrsingh
